main_definition: Pensions refer to a regular payment made during a person's retirement from an investment fund to which that person or their employer has contributed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sum of money paid regularly by the government or other institution to people who have retired, particularly after they reach a certain age.
meanings_and_examples.example: After retiring at 65, John received his pension payments every month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An arrangement in which a person receives financial support from an organization or fund during their retirement years.
meanings_and_examples.example: The church provided for its clergy members by giving them a pension after they retired.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A legal entitlement to receive periodic payments, typically in the form of income, from an employer or government as part of retirement benefits.
meanings_and_examples.example: As part of her employee's benefits package, she will be entitled to a pension after 30 years of service.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In some countries, a 'pensionado card' refers to an identity document issued by the government for retirees, which grants them certain privileges and discounts.
meanings_and_examples.example: With her pensionado card, Maria was able to enjoy special discounts at local stores.
